title: 7 Simple Ways to Add a Check Mark to a Word Document

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear. You can put a checkmark before, after, or in between characters. steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This will be on the top toolbar, between Home and Draw .

steps.title: Click Symbol.
steps.content: Click Symbol . This will be in the Symbols section, next to Equation .

steps.title: Click More Symbols….
steps.content: Click More Symbols… . A new window will open.

steps.title: Click the "Font" drop-down menu and select Wingdings.
steps.content: Click the "Font" drop-down menu and select Wingdings . The drop-down menu will be at the top of the window, in the Symbols tab. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Select the check mark symbol.
steps.content: Select the check mark symbol. When you switch to Wingdings, you'll see a new collection of symbols. Find the check mark located near the bottom of the selection. You may need to scroll down.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This will add the check mark to your document. The window won't close after clicking Insert . You can place your cursor in another area and click Insert again to add another checkmark in another location. When you're finished, click Close to return to your document. If you need to add another checkmark later, click Insert → Symbol → select the checkmark from the drop-down menu. It will now appear since you used it recently.

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear. You can put a checkmark before, after, or in between characters.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This will be on the top toolbar, between Home and Draw .

steps.title: Click Advanced Symbol.
steps.content: Click Advanced Symbol . You can find this on the right side, next to Equation .

steps.title: Click Symbols.
steps.content: Click Symbols . This is the left tab. You may already be on this tab.

steps.title: Select the check mark symbol.
steps.content: Select the check mark symbol. Scroll through the available symbols until you find the checkmark, then click it. If you can't find the checkmark icon, click the "Font" drop-down menu, scroll down, and select Wingdings . New symbols will appear. Select the checkmark.

steps.title: Click Insert.
steps.content: Click Insert . This is the blue button in the bottom-right corner. The check mark will be added to your document. The window won't close after clicking Insert . You can place your cursor in another area and click Insert again to add another checkmark in another location. When you're finished inserting a check mark symbol, click Close to return to your document.

steps.title: Click the Insert menu in Word.
steps.content: Click the Insert menu in Word. Another easy way to add a check mark to your Word document is to create a simple keyboard shortcut. Start by clicking the Insert tab, which is on the top toolbar between Home and Draw . [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. steps.title: Click the "Font" drop-down menu and select Wingdings.
steps.content: Click the "Font" drop-down menu and select Wingdings . The drop-down menu will be at the top of the window, in the Symbols tab. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select the check mark symbol.
steps.content: Select the check mark symbol. When you switch to Wingdings, you'll see a new collection of symbols. Find the check mark located near the bottom of the selection. You may need to scroll down.

steps.title: Click Shortcut Key….
steps.content: Click Shortcut Key… . This will be on the bottom-left corner, next to AutoCorrect... .

steps.title: Assign a shortcut.
steps.content: Assign a shortcut. Click the "Press new shortcut key" field if your cursor isn't already in the field. Use a combination of a modifier key (such as Alt) and an alphanumeric key. For example, press ALT + C at the same time. This will assign the checkmark symbol to this shortcut. Avoid using a combination of keys that already represents a different shortcut. (Ex: CTRL + C , which already represents Copy .)

steps.title: Click Assign.
steps.content: Click Assign . This will assign your shortcut to the checkmark symbol. Click Close on the Customize Keyboard window and Symbol window.

steps.title: Use your shortcut.
steps.content: Use your shortcut. If you set ALT + C as your shortcut, press it on your keyboard. The checkmark symbol will be entered wherever your cursor is. Make sure to save your document .

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear. You can put a checkmark before, after, or in between characters. This method will only work if you have a full-sized keyboard that has a numeric keypad.

steps.title: On your full-sized keyboard, hold down Alt and type 0252.
steps.content: On your full-sized keyboard, hold down Alt and type 0252 . You should be using the 0252 on your number pad. [7] X Research source This is the section on the far-right of your keyboard. Make sure your Number Lock (NumLock) is enabled. The character will appear as an umlaut in most fonts.

steps.title: Highlight the character and change the font to "Wingdings".
steps.content: Highlight the character and change the font to "Wingdings". It must be changed to Wingdings in order to appear as a checkmark.

steps.title: Use the on-screen keyboard (optional).
steps.content: Use the on-screen keyboard (optional). Use these steps only if you don't have a full-sized keyboard. On Windows, type "on-screen keyboard" into the Start menu and launch the program. Click Options on the keyboard and check the box next to Turn on numeric key pad . Click OK . Click NumLock to enable it. The key will turn blue and reveal the numbers. Hold Alt on your physical keyboard and use your mouse to click 0252 on the on-screen keyboard. You may need to press any key on your keyboard for the umlaut to appear. Highlight the character and change the font to "Wingdings".

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear. You can put a checkmark before, after, or in between characters using a checkmark emoji.

steps.title: Click the Edit menu.
steps.content: Click the Edit menu. You'll see it at the top-right corner of your Mac's screen. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Emoji & Symbols.
steps.content: Click Emoji & Symbols . This opens Character Viewer, which contains many symbols and emoji you can easily add to any document. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Search for the check.
steps.content: Search for the check . Type check into the search bar to filter the symbols to display only checkmarks.

steps.title: Click the checkmark to add it to your document.
steps.content: Click the checkmark to add it to your document. You can now insert additional check mark symbols or close the Character Viewer to return to your document.

steps.title: Enable the "Developer" tab in Word.
steps.content: Enable the "Developer" tab in Word. If you need to create an entire clickable checklist in your document, you'll need to enable the Developer tab first. Go to File → Options → Customize Ribbon . Check the box for Developer underneath the Main Tabs header. Click OK .

steps.title: Click the Developer tab.
steps.content: Click the Developer tab. After enabling it, this will be located between View and Help . [10] X Research source

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear. You can put a checkmark before, after, or in between characters.

steps.title: Click the checkmark box.
steps.content: Click the checkmark box. This can be found in the Controls section. It looks like a box with a green checkmark inside. The checkmark box will be added to your document. [11] X Research source Click the box to mark the X inside. This will save to your default layout, but you can always create a Word template to make it easier to create clickable checklists in the future.

steps.title: Open a project in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open a project in Microsoft Word. This looks like a W on top of a blue square. Microsoft Word is available to install for Windows and Mac. You must have a subscription to use Office 365. Use this method to create a list with checkmarks.

steps.title: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear.
steps.content: Place your cursor where you want the check mark to appear. This is where you'll create your list.

steps.title: Click the bullet list arrow.
steps.content: Click the bullet list arrow. This will be in the Paragraph section. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Define New Bullet….
steps.content: Click Define New Bullet… . You can find this at the bottom of the drop-down menu. [12] X Research source A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Symbol.
steps.content: Click Symbol . This will be at the top of the pop-up window. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Click the "Font" drop-down menu and select Wingdings.
steps.content: Click the "Font" drop-down menu and select Wingdings . The drop-down menu will be at the top of the window, in the Symbols tab. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Select the check mark symbol.
steps.content: Select the check mark symbol. When you switch to Wingdings, you'll see a new collection of symbols. Find the check mark located near the bottom of the selection. You may need to scroll down.

steps.title: Press OK twice.
steps.content: Press OK twice. You'll need to click OK to close the Symbol window and Define New Bullet window.

steps.title: Use your checkmark list.
steps.content: Use your checkmark list. Click the bullet list drop-down menu and select the checkmark from the Bullet Library . Enter any line of text you want, then press Enter to create a new checkmark on the next line. If needed, you can format your document if you want to adjust the style.
